transportAdvice: St. Louis has a light rail system and bus network that connects major attractions including the Gateway Arch and Forest Park, though a car is often more practical for exploring beyond the central tourist areas. Taxis and rideshare vehicles are generally available downtown, and many key sights are walkable within the central districts.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional snow or freezing rain, making outdoor sightseeing uncomfortable.
Still cold with a mix of rain and snow, though slightly milder than January.
Temperatures begin to rise but spring storms and rain are common throughout the month.
Mild and pleasant but expect frequent spring showers and occasional thunderstorms.
Warm and green with frequent thunderstorms, a lively time to visit outdoor attractions.
Hot and humid with occasional afternoon thunderstorms, outdoor activities are best done in the morning.
The hottest month, with oppressive humidity and heat making midday sightseeing draining.
Still very hot and humid, similar to July, with occasional thunderstorms providing brief relief.
Temperatures begin to ease and humidity drops, making this a more comfortable month to explore.
Crisp and pleasant autumn weather with colorful foliage, one of the best months to visit.
Cooling quickly with increasing cloud cover and rain, though early November can still be mild.
Cold and wintry with a chance of snow, but festive holiday events animate the city.
